items.title: Weather’s Mild Turn Sends Spot Gas Prices Into Freefall
items.summary: Spot gas prices plunged Monday as traders anticipated weakening demand amid a warming temperature outlook, particularly in the recently frigid Northeast.

items.title: Natural Gas Market Ignores Venezuela Noise as Weak Fundamentals Sink Futures
items.summary: February Nymex natural gas futures tumbled on Monday, pressured by expectations for lackluster demand amid persistently mild weather through the balance of winter.

items.title: Bearish Signals Stack Up as Natural Gas Futures Slip Below Support
items.summary: Technical charts suggest natural gas futures, which sank early Monday, could see deeper losses before finding a firmer level of support.

items.title: Midday Snapshot: Natural Gas Spot Prices Slide as Demand Stalls
items.summary: Natural gas physical markets were trending sharply lower into midday Monday, putting them on track for a third consecutive decline as warmer forecasts cut heating demand across much of the Lower 48.

items.title: New Year Starts With a Whimper for Sinking Global Natural Gas Prices
items.summary: Ample LNG and pipeline supplies have offset the frigid weather gripping Europe as the new year gets underway, keeping global natural gas prices under pressure despite colder conditions.

items.title: Beyond Crude: Could the Fall of Venezuela’s Maduro Impact North American Natural Gas?
items.summary: While the capture of ousted Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro by U.S. forces has been the focus of global oil markets, a secondary and large opportunity exists in natural gas, according to analysts.

items.title: Afternoon Pulse: Natural Gas Futures Trim Early Losses as Cold Signals Linger
items.summary: Natural gas futures trimmed early losses at midday Monday after starting the session down as much as 26 cents, as traders weighed warmer near-term weather against lingering signals for colder conditions later in January.

items.title: Carnival LNG Offtake Deal Advances Stabilis’ Planned Galveston Bunkering Hub
items.summary: Stabilis Solutions Inc. has landed an agreement to supply LNG to a major cruise line, securing its second long-term agreement for a developing bunkering project in Galveston, TX.

items.title: Midmorning Markets: Natural Gas Spot Prices Tracking Lower in Early Trading
items.summary: Natural gas physical markets were trading weaker early Monday as milder weather pressured, with Henry Hub spot gas possibly on track to fall below $3/MMBtu for the first time in more than two months.

items.title: From Oil to LNG, Too Much Supply Is Still the Problem in 2026
items.summary: Crude oil began trade this year with a dip, despite the news about U.S. strikes on Venezuela and the taking of President Nicolas Maduro to the U.S. Normally, such events would have pushed oil higher, but not this year. This year, oil prices will need

items.title: Trump’s Venezuela Oil Dream Meets a $100 Billion Reality Check
items.summary: The shock-and-awe capture of Nicolas Maduro by the United States, which was the culmination of the U.S. pressure on Venezuela in recent months, ended a tumultuous chapter in the history of the South American nation sitting on 17% of the world’s prove

items.title: The Libya Oil Story No One Is Pricing In Yet
items.summary: With more than 40 companies having now registered their interest in Libya’s first oil field licensing round since the removal of Muammar Gaddafi as leader in 2011, the National Oil Corporation (NOC) is confident it can lift oil production to 2 millio

items.title: The Quiet Unraveling of the Power Grid Monopoly
items.summary: Will the electric utility distribution monopolies (”discos”) remain financially viable over the longer term? That is the question, and not an idle one.  When the government broke up the Bell Systemm (some of you may remember that formerly ubiquitous

items.title: Iraq’s Gas Breakthrough Could Rewrite the Middle East Power Map
items.summary: Iraq’s Oil Ministry has confirmed that it is expediting the development of the Gharraf and Nassiriyah gas projects, with full operations expected to begin by early 2027, and production capacity reaching 200 million standard cubic feet per day (mmscf/

items.title: EIA: Oversupply And Sluggish Demand To Blame For Weak Oil Prices In 2025
items.summary: The U.S. Energy Information Administration has revealed that global oil supplies exceeded demand in 2025, leading to a sharp decline in oil prices. Monthly average Brent crude oil prices declined from $79 per barrel in January to $63 per barrel in De
